title:
Global derivation of the 1D Vlasov-Poisson equation from quantum
  many-body dynamics with screened Coulomb potential
authors: Xuwen Chen, Shunlin Shen, Ping Zhang, Zhifei Zhang
abstract:
We study the 1D quantum many-body dynamics with a screened Coulomb potential
in the mean-field setting. Combining the quantum mean-field, semiclassical, and
Debye length limits, we prove the global derivation of the 1D Vlasov-Poisson
equation. We tackle the difficulties brought by the pure state data, whose
Wigner transforms converge to Wigner measures. We find new weighted uniform
estimates around which we build the proof. As a result, we obtain, globally,
stronger limits, and hence the global existence of solutions to the 1D
Vlasov-Poisson equation subject to such Wigner measure data, which satisfy
conservation laws of mass, momentum, and energy, despite being measure
solutions. This happens to solve the 1D case of an open problem regarding the
conservation law of the Vlasov-Poisson equation raised in [18] by Diperna and
Lions.
